Package breakout

Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.image.ImageView
breakout.Sprite
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ball, GamePaddle, MultiBrick, PowerUp
public class Sprite
extends javafx.scene.image.ImageView
The Sprite class is the top class in my hierarchy. It extends ImageView and I chose to do this because there are common fields among all its child classes which can be used as a common blueprint that can be extended to all child classes. This is extremely important and I specifically chose to do this to meet Object Oriented Programming design standards that encourage common functionality/data between multiple child classes to be extracted and moved up in the hierarchy for a common parent class. Using ImageView as my template was specifically chosen over Shapes like Rectangle because I can then keep all the objects in my game under just one parent instead including both Rectangles and Circles Shapes for example.

  • Constructor Details

    • Sprite

      Sprite​(java.lang.String name, int lives, javafx.scene.image.Image image)
      This is the default constructor for the
      Parameters:
      name - The string value that is used to identify the Sprite object.
      lives - The number of lives for any Sprite (or child) object.
      image - The .gif file that is used to display the Sprite in the scene.
